content:
EXISTING STRUCTURES
────────────────────────
### Stone Furnace Facility at position (0.0, 0.0)
Consists of:
– Stone Furnace (position: 0.0, 0.0)
– Iron Chest (position: 1.5, 0.5)

### Iron Ore Mining Setup at position (-16.0, -51.0)
Consists of:
– Burner Mining Drill (position: -16.0, -51.0)
– Burner Inserter (position: -14.5, -49.5)
– Transport Belt (position: -15.5, -49.5)
– Iron Chest (position: -13.5, -49.5)
– Intermediate Transport Belt (position: -15.5, -47.5)
– Burner Inserter (position: -14.5, -47.5)
– Remote Output Chest (position: -13.5, -47.5)

### Copper Furnace at position (-27.0, -60.0)
Consists of:
– Stone Furnace (position: -27.0, -60.0)

### Lab Power Integration System at position (0.5, 2.5)
Consists of:
– Lab (position: 0.5, 2.5)
– Offshore Pump (position: -7.5, 25.5)
– Boiler (position: 2.0, 17.5)
– Steam Engine (position: 5.5, 5.5)

### Pipe Production Facility at position (3.5, 0.5)
Consists of:
– Assembling Machine (position: 3.5, 0.5) [warnings: not receiving electricity; missing iron-plate for pipe production]
– Iron Chest (position: 1.5, 0.5)
– Electricity network via small electric poles interlinking facility components (e.g., at positions: 3.5, -2.5; 5.5, 0.5; 3.5, 2.5; 4.5, 3.5; 6.5, 3.5)

### Pipe Groups (Fluid Pipelines)
Consists of the following updated interconnected pipeline sections:
  #### PipeGroup at position (8.5, 5.5) with fluid_system == 111948
  Consists of:
  – Pipe (position: 8.5, 5.5)
  – Pipe (position: 8.5, 6.5)

  #### PipeGroup at position (10.5, 4.5) with fluid_system == 111949
  Consists of:
  – Pipe (position: 10.5, 4.5)
  – Pipe (position: 11.5, 4.5)
  – Pipe (position: 12.5, 4.5) with additional segments (e.g., (7.5, 14.5), (7.5, 15.5), (8.5, 14.5))

  #### PipeGroup at position (-9.5, 9.5) with fluid_system == 111952, fluid=water
  Consists of:
  – Pipe (position: -9.5, 9.5)
  – Pipe (position: -8.5, 9.5)
  – Pipe (position: -8.5, 8.5) with subsequent segments up to (0.5, 24.5)

  #### PipeGroup at position (2.5, 9.5) with fluid_system == 111955
  Consists of:
  – Pipe (position: 2.5, 9.5)
  – Pipe (position: 3.5, 9.5)
  – Pipe (position: 3.5, 10.5)
  – Pipe (position: 3.5, 11.5)
  – Pipe (position: 2.5, 10.5)

  #### PipeGroup at position (10.5, 9.5) with fluid_system == 111956
  Consists of:
  – Pipe (position: 10.5, 9.5)
  – Pipe (position: 10.5, 8.5)
  – Pipe (position: 9.5, 15.5) with further segments (e.g., (9.5, 16.5), (6.5, 18.5), (7.5, 18.5))

  #### PipeGroup at position (1.5, 11.5) with fluid_system == 111961
  Consists of:
  – Pipe (position: 1.5, 11.5)
  – Pipe (position: 1.5, 13.5)
  – Pipe (position: 0.5, 13.5) with additional segments (e.g., (5.5, 14.5), (4.5, 14.5), (4.5, 15.5))

  #### PipeGroup at position (-1.5, 17.5) with fluid_system == 111972
  Consists of:
  – Pipe (position: -1.5, 17.5)

  #### PipeGroup at position (6.5, 16.5) with fluid_system == 111975
  Consists of:
  – Pipe (position: 6.5, 16.5)

  #### PipeGroup at position (-1.5, 21.5) with fluid_system == 111976
  Consists of:
  – Pipe (position: -1.5, 21.5)

  Additional integrated components:
  – ElectricityGroup (id: 34577) connecting small electric poles at positions (5.5, 0.5), (3.5, -2.5), (7.5, 0.5), (3.5, 2.5), (4.5, 3.5) and (6.5, 3.5)
  – Belt connections linking parts of the Iron Ore Mining Setup (e.g., belts at positions -15.5, -49.5 and -15.5, -47.5)

ERROR TIPS
────────────────────────
• Candidate PipeGroup Connection Failures
  – Connection attempts using candidate PipeGroups with fluid_system identifiers [110836, 110978, 111120, 111262, 111404, 111546, 111688, 111830] near (-1.5, 17.5) have repeatedly failed.
   Tip: Verify candidate existence and correct spatial alignment before starting connection routines.

• Assembling Machine Resource and Power Issues
  – The assembling machine at (3.5, 0.5) is not receiving electricity and is missing iron-plate required for pipe production.
   Tip: Ensure a stable power supply and adequate resource inventory to support production.

• Burner Mining Drill Fuel Shortage
  – The burner mining drill at (-16.0, -51.0) has depleted fuel.
   Tip: Provide sufficient fuel to the burner mining drill before attempting resource extraction.

• Power Generation and Fluid Supply Connection Issues
  – The boiler at (2.0, 17.5) and the steam engine at (5.5, 5.5) continue to show connectivity issues regarding fluid inputs.
   Tip: Confirm proper fluid supply and secure connection points for both the boiler and the steam engine.

• Insufficient Inventory for Fluid Connections
  – There is an inadequate allocation of pipes and connection components affecting fluid connection setups.
   Tip: Verify inventory levels for pipes and related components prior to establishing fluid connections.

NAMESPACE
────────────────────────
• get_entity(entity: Any, position: Any) -> Any  
  – Retrieves an entity of the specified type at the given position.
   • Success Mode: Returns the located entity.
   • Failure Mode: Raises an exception if the entity is not found.

• pipe_entity(pipe: entities.Pipe) -> Any  
  – Processes a pipe entity during pipeline connection routines.

• rotate_entity(entity: Any, direction: Any) -> Any  
  – Rotates the given entity to the specified direction to correct its alignment.

• insert_item(resource: Any, target: Any, quantity: int) -> Any  
  – Inserts a specified quantity of the resource into the target inventory; returns the updated target on success.

• get_connection_amount(virtual_candidate: Any, boiler_connection: Any, pipe_proto: Prototype.Pipe) -> int  
  – Calculates the number of pipe segments required to establish a fluid connection; raises an exception if conditions are not met.

Important Variables:
• pump_working (OffshorePump) – Holds the working offshore pump entity at position (-7.5, 25.5).
• boiler_original (Boiler) – Represents the boiler entity at position (2.0, 17.5).
• candidate_intermediate_offpump (Position) – Candidate connection point for linking the Offshore Pump.
• candidate_intermediate_boiler (Position) – Candidate connection point for linking the Boiler.
• boiler_connection_point (Position) – Intended connection point for the boiler’s water supply.
• steam_engine_connection_point (Position) – Intended connection point for the Steam Engine’s steam input.
• pipe_count (int) – Tracks the current number of available pipes.
• distance (float) – Calculated distance for pipeline segments.
• final_inventory (Inventory) – Snapshot of inventory item counts after recent operations.
• virtual_candidate (Position) – Virtual candidate connection point used for manual pipe placement.
